org.forgerock.opendj.ldap

Class LDAPListenerOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.opendj.ldap.LDAPListenerOptions

  • public final class LDAPListenerOptions
extends Object
    Common options for LDAP listeners.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LDAPListenerOptions()
      Creates a new set of listener options with default settings.
      LDAPListenerOptions(LDAPListenerOptions options)
      Creates a new set of listener options having the same initial set of options as the provided set of listener options.

    • Method Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • LDAPListenerOptions

        public LDAPListenerOptions()
        Creates a new set of listener options with default settings. SSL will not be enabled, and a default set of decode options will be used.

      • LDAPListenerOptions

        public LDAPListenerOptions(LDAPListenerOptions options)
        Creates a new set of listener options having the same initial set of options as the provided set of listener options.
        Parameters:
        options - The set of listener options to be copied.

    • Method Detail

      • getBacklog

        public int getBacklog()
        Returns the maximum queue length for incoming connections requests. If a connection request arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused. If the backlog is less than 1 then a default value of 50 will be used.
        Returns:
        The maximum queue length for incoming connections requests.

      • getMaxRequestSize

        public int getMaxRequestSize()
        Returns the maximum request size in bytes for incoming LDAP requests. If an incoming request exceeds the limit then the connection will be aborted by the listener. If the limit is less than 1 then a default value of 5MB will be used.
        Returns:
        The maximum request size in bytes for incoming LDAP requests.

      • setBacklog

        public LDAPListenerOptions setBacklog(int backlog)
        Sets the maximum queue length for incoming connections requests. If a connection request arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused. If the backlog is less than 1 then a default value of 50 will be used.
        Parameters:
        backlog - The maximum queue length for incoming connections requests.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP listener options.

      • setMaxRequestSize

        public LDAPListenerOptions setMaxRequestSize(int maxRequestSize)
        Sets the maximum request size in bytes for incoming LDAP requests. If an incoming request exceeds the limit then the connection will be aborted by the listener. If the limit is less than 1 then a default value of 5MB will be used.
        Parameters:
        maxRequestSize - The maximum request size in bytes for incoming LDAP requests.
        Returns:
        A reference to this LDAP listener options.

      • setDecodeOptions

        public LDAPListenerOptions setDecodeOptions(DecodeOptions decodeOptions)
        Sets the decoding options which will be used to control how requests and responses are decoded.
        Parameters:
        decodeOptions - The decoding options which will be used to control how requests and responses are decoded (never null).
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • setTCPNIOTransport

        public LDAPListenerOptions setTCPNIOTransport(org.glassfish.grizzly.nio.transport.TCPNIOTransport transport)
        Sets the Grizzly TCP transport which will be used when initiating connections with the Directory Server.

        By default this method will return null indicating that the default transport factory should be used to obtain a TCP transport.

        Parameters:
        transport - The Grizzly TCP transport which will be used when initiating connections with the Directory Server, or null if the default transport factory should be used to obtain a TCP transport.
        Returns:
        A reference to this connection options.

      • getDecodeOptions

        public DecodeOptions getDecodeOptions()
        Returns the decoding options which will be used to control how requests and responses are decoded.
        Returns:
        The decoding options which will be used to control how requests and responses are decoded (never null).

      • getLinger

        public int getLinger()
        Returns the value of the SO_LINGER socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is -1 (disabled) and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.linger property.

        Returns:
        The value of the SO_LINGER socket option for new connections, or -1 if linger should be disabled.

      • isKeepAlive

        public boolean isKeepAlive()
        Returns the value of the SO_KEEPALIVE socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is true and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.keepAlive property.

        Returns:
        The value of the SO_KEEPALIVE socket option for new connections.

      • isReuseAddress

        public boolean isReuseAddress()
        Returns the value of the SO_REUSEADDR socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is true and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.reuseAddress property.

        Returns:
        The value of the SO_REUSEADDR socket option for new connections.

      • isTCPNoDelay

        public boolean isTCPNoDelay()
        Returns the value of the TCP_NODELAY socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is true and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.tcpNoDelay property.

        Returns:
        The value of the TCP_NODELAY socket option for new connections.

      • setKeepAlive

        public T setKeepAlive(boolean keepAlive)
        Specifies the value of the SO_KEEPALIVE socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is true and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.keepAlive property.

        Parameters:
        keepAlive - The value of the SO_KEEPALIVE socket option for new connections.
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • setLinger

        public T setLinger(int linger)
        Specifies the value of the SO_LINGER socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is -1 (disabled) and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.linger property.

        Parameters:
        linger - The value of the SO_LINGER socket option for new connections, or -1 if linger should be disabled.
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • setReuseAddress

        public T setReuseAddress(boolean reuseAddress)
        Specifies the value of the SO_REUSEADDR socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is true and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.reuseAddress property.

        Parameters:
        reuseAddress - The value of the SO_REUSEADDR socket option for new connections.
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • setTCPNoDelay

        public T setTCPNoDelay(boolean tcpNoDelay)
        Specifies the value of the TCP_NODELAY socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is true and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.tcpNoDelay property.

        Parameters:
        tcpNoDelay - The value of the TCP_NODELAY socket option for new connections.
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • getTCPNIOTransport

        public org.glassfish.grizzly.nio.transport.TCPNIOTransport getTCPNIOTransport()
        Returns the Grizzly TCP transport which will be used when initiating connections with the Directory Server.

        By default this method will return null indicating that the default transport factory should be used to obtain a TCP transport.

        Returns:
        The Grizzly TCP transport which will be used when initiating connections with the Directory Server, or null if the default transport factory should be used to obtain a TCP transport.
